DOC.detailed_description: Cardiovascular disease ( CVD ) prevalent lead cause mortality United States . The American Heart Association 's ( AHA ) 2020 Impact Goal improve cardiovascular health Americans 20 percent reduce death CVD stroke 20 percent . Maintaining healthy level physical activity ( PA ) critical maintain cardiovascular health , old adult inactive . Inactivity may influence low level motivation . Standard behavioral counseling technique typically implement within primary care set target increase motivation , lack key component self-control . The addition electronic activity monitor ( EAMs ) provide interactive self-monitoring , feedback , social support may increase motivation exercise provide effective behavior change technique standard protocol . Investigators conduct three month intervention trial test feasibility add EAM system brief counsel within primary care set . Participants ( N = 40 ) randomize receive evidence-based brief counsel plus either EAM pedometer . Investigators propose two Specific Aims : AIM 1 : Evaluate feasibility acceptability implement technology-enhanced brief intervention increase physical activity primary care set . Measures feasibility include day EAM worn , usage app , technological problem , attrition , adverse event . Acceptability measure self-report focus group . AIM 2 : Compare counsel plus EAM intervention counsel plus pedometer intervention . Primary outcome change PA cardiovascular risk . We also investigate secondary outcome ( difference adherence , weight body composition , health status , motivation , physical function , psychological feeling , self-regulation ) .
